author: _shemnon
content: My concern is it would make gas charges within a transaction depend on the other transactions within the same block.  This would degrade the developer experience as there would be a new way for gas charges to become variable.

author: greenforer
content: But, if developers assume that all first accesses within the context of the transaction are cold (as they currently are), that shouldn't be an issue, right? You're guaranteed it will at the worst be as expensive as before (in respect to accesses), but a lucky transaction can get extra saves

author: _shemnon
content: There is also MEV, block construction, and tracing/replay to worry about, not just developers.  I would want to see a compelling reason to make all those parties lives more complex to support this, other than "saves gas for defi."  I think the complexity imposed on these downstream users imposes a high burden of need on the proposal.  Since 2929 was initially implemented to address security and stability issues then I would expect a good reason to change it would also address security and stability.

author: _shemnon
content:
We have an evm implementors call wednesday and will have a better feel then,

As far as I know single step or two step EOF are both viable options and IMHO would depend on the desired schedule for Cancun.  My view is that SSZ transactions are what is driving that part and that most of the devs are a somewhat orthagonal group between those two tasks.
